title: Fieldset schemas
description: Â© 2025 Go2 Software LLC. Licensed under the Open Data Commons Attribution License (ODC-By). 'Kenfigure' is a trademark of Go2 Software LLC. Unauthorized use is prohibited.
comment: All types of fieldset schemas (e.g., Custom enity, DNA Sequence, etc.). Does not currently support tool tips or parent links for fields.

items.title: Fieldset schema definition
items.description: Complete description of the fieldset schema.

System name.description: Internal system name. Default will be an automatic conversion of Name to a Benchling/PostgreSQL compatible name.

Description.description: Documentation for the fieldset schema. This is not saved to Benchling.

Notify.description: Causes the supplied message to be printed to the output during an import operation. Use this to tell the user to take some manual action such as setting permissions.

Entity type.description: Must match one of the Benchling-defined types. May be 'None' to enable attaching to any type of entity schema.

Category.description: If true (default), this fieldset will appear as a navigation category for end users, and an option for field definitions.

Prefix.description: The registry ID prefix. If specified, will override the prefix for all attached entity schemas.

Naming options.description: Available registration naming options. If specified, will override the naming options for all attached entity schemas.

items.description: Valid enum values include symbolic names and full text versions
enum: Generate registry IDs based on entity names
Generate new registry IDs and replace name with registry ID
Generate new registry IDs, rename according to name template, and keep old name as alias
Generate new registry IDs, and replace name according to name template
Keep existing entity names as registry IDs
Generate registry IDs and names according to name template

Definition.description: Depending on Type will be text, a field name, or may be omitted if N/A.

Name template.$comment: TODO: Need to define this better. How handle pre-defiend values like separator, lot, etc.

Constraint.description: List of fields to define constraint. Maybe empty. May contain special built-in field descriptions. If specified, will override the constraint for all attached entity schemas.

Diagram.description: Properties solely used for diagram rendering.

Description.description: Documentation for the field. This is not saved to Benchling.

System name.description: Internal system name for the field. Default will be an automatic conversion of Name to a Benchling/PostgreSQL compatible name.

Multi-select.description: Field is a multi-select field when true.

Definition.description: Name of target object if Type is a one of the link types or Dropdown.

Computed.description: Describes the computed field. Only present for computed fields.

Formula.description: Name of formula using native Benchling tokens for now.

Path.description: List of entities to get to the final entity or field. TODO-Can this just be a list. Will type ever not be Field?

Type.description: Type of path component. Only Field is valid for now.

Definition.description: Name for the given type. Usually a field name.

Property.description: The final value to return/compute at the end of the Path.

Type.description: The type of property. Normally Field, but use BASES to access the built-in Bases field.

Definition.description: The name of the field if type is Field.

API ID.description: API ID for the entity schema created during an export operation. This is ignored for import operations.
